application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; Austin, TX, USA
description:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products, services, and the people behind them. Whether you are making our people systems more efficient, planning for our growth, or optimizing a process, you have an eye for detail and strive to maximize impact across our broader Google landscape. You are passionate about solving challenges through technology. You are highly organized and have excellent analytical and communication skills. As a Salesforce Project Manager, you will support the execution of our most critical programs for all Googlers globally. You will be resourceful, creative, driven and excited to share the magic of working at Google.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in project management.
  • 3 years of experience working with Salesforce, Workday and/or other enterprise class business systems within the HR domain.
  • Experience in global HR operations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to implement large-scale programs with excellent project management skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
  • Ability to engage with leadership effectively, facilitate discussions about complex topics, influence effectively, and reach agreement.
  • Ability to take initiative and remain motivated, work independently, achieve goals in ambiguous environments, prioritize work, and implement structure and clarity.
  • Ability to be diplomatic and influence stakeholders, vendors, and international teams.
responsibilities:
• Lead or collaborate on cross-functional, multi-regional projects, such as systems implementations, aimed at designing and implementing strategic solutions for complex HR challenges.
  • Develop data-driven solutions, presenting to peers, managers, and partners, and focus on improving operational efficiencies and Googler experience, identifying both short and long-term opportunities.
  • Write business requirements documents (BRDs) for new systems/functionality and work with People Operations (POps) Works Engineering teams to implement them. Engage cross-functional stakeholders to Identify, prioritize, and triage requirements, design efficient, scalable, and effective business processes, and define and execute user acceptance test cases.
  • Produce and manage all project related documentation including project plans, status dashboards, stakeholders communications, project updates, and roadmap.
  • Support change management to ensure new processes/technology lands well with Googlers and the People Operations Team. Ensure that the voice of the user is represented in all project work.
title: Salesforce Project Manager, Process Design and Technology
